original_title: Federal Reserve Holds Interest Rates Steady
original_body:
The Federal Reserve kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5.25-5.50% following its two-day policy meeting on Wednesday.

Fed Chair Jerome Powell indicated that the central bank remains focused on bringing inflation back to its 2% target while monitoring labor market conditions. The decision was unanimous among voting members.

"We are prepared to adjust policy as appropriate," Powell said in his post-meeting press conference.

Markets had widely expected the decision. The Fed's next meeting is scheduled for December.
